section.title: Offline Licensing Mode Guide
section.para: Information contained in this document supercedes some of the information in: , , , , .

Offline licensing mode changes the licensing scheme so that a license is required to manage a &PB; device. The &PB; device will under no circumstances display a banner indicating that it is not licenced. There is no requirement for a &COMPANY_NAME_SHORT; licensing server in your infrastructure when using offline licensing mode.

important.para: Offline licensing mode is not part of the standard &PB; product. Using offline licensing mode is strictly allowed only by explicit agreement with &COMPANY_NAME_SHORT;.

warning.para: Do not run the xclicd dæmon when using offline licensing mode.

section.para: To use offline licensing mode, start by copying your &PB; licenses to your &BACKEND; server. Then use the xclicimp command to import license information into the &BACKEND; database, connecting as the &BACKEND;_name_license user. The number of available licenses will be decremented by one whenever you run the sync-admin add-device command to add a new device. If you run out of licenses, the sync-admin add-device will fail until further licenses are purchased and imported.
